availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Mason Rose (Graves County farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy W. Rose. Father of Mary A. Rose, E. M. Rose, Richard A. Rose, Kindred M. Rose, Elias C. Rose, Reuben Rose, and James J. Rose. Farmer in Graves County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District No.1, p. 431B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 246.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Felicianna, p. 50.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District No. 1, p. 126.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 48A.
